conclusion: Use the first law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W.
ΔU is the change in internal energy, Q is the heat exchanged, W is the work done by the gas.
Given: ΔU = 200 J. Process from A to C involves A to B (isobaric) and B to C (isochoric).
Segment A to B is isobaric with p_A = p_B = 3 x 10^5 Pa.
Volume change from A to B: ΔV = V_B - V_A = 3 x 10^-3 m^3.
Work done W_AB = p ΔV = 900 J.
Segment B to C is isochoric with V_B = V_C = 4 x 10^-3 m^3.
Pressure change from B to C: Δp = -2 x 10^5 Pa.
Total work done W = W_AB + W_BC = 900 J.
Apply first law: ΔU = Q - W, 200 J = Q - 900 J.
Final answer: Heat Q exchanged is 1100 J.
